intro: Hibbertia paeninsularis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves and vibrant yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Hibbertia paeninsularis is an herbaceous perennial that produces showy, tubular flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
